properties.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued February 12 at 3:27AM CST until February 13 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Kansas City/Pleasant HIll MO
properties.description:
...Wintry Mess Wednesday...

.A winter storm will spread northward across eastern Kansas and
Missouri this morning, and linger through tonight. This storm
will start as snow, but surface temperatures may warm up just
enough to convert the precipitation type to rain or a rain/snow
mix by the afternoon hours. This may lead to slushy roads today. This
evening temperatures will fall back below freezing as a strong
cold front moves through the area changing precipitation back to
all snow. In addition, with temperatues falling quickly tonight,
any wet surfaces and roadways are expected to flash freeze and
cause further travel issues.

* WHAT...Very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as
15 to 25 below zero.

* WHERE...Portions of northeast Kansas and north central and
northwest Missouri.

* WHEN...From midnight tonight to noon CST Thursday.

* IMPACTS...The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on
exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Roadways may remain slick overnight into
Thursday as temperatures remain well below freezing.
properties.instruction:
Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a
hat, and gloves.

NWSheadline: WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO NOON CST THURSDAY
